tags.name: zui-shell-apps
tags.description:
`zui-shell-apps` is our product launchpad and is a topbar feature. This is the primary method of jumping from application to application. Consumers should set this up to only list products the user has access to.

### Examples
Default
```html
<zui-shell-apps unresolved>
   <zui-shell-apps-item unresolved
     slot="apps"
     name="Broker Briefcase"
     description="Growth & marketing platform"
     url="#">
   </zui-shell-apps-item>
</zui-shell-apps>
```

With an optional "view all apps" link
```html
<zui-shell-apps all-apps-url="http://www.zywave.com" all-apps-text="See all products" unresolved>
   <zui-shell-apps-item unresolved
     slot="apps"
     name="Broker Briefcase"
     description="Growth & marketing platform"
     url="#">
   </zui-shell-apps-item>
</zui-shell-apps>
```

attributes.name: app-header
attributes.description: Header for the apps dropdown. (Default: Apps)

attributes.name: all-apps-url
attributes.description:
Link to view all apps in a separate location.
Set this property if you want the "See all" links
to appear at the bottom of your apps list. (Optional)

attributes.name: all-apps-text
attributes.description:
Text for the link to view all apps in a separate location.
Will not show up if `all-apps-url` is not set. (Optional)

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Opens the dropdown menu when `open` is set to true.

properties.name: appHeader
properties.description: Header for the apps dropdown. (Default: Apps)

properties.name: allAppsUrl
properties.description:
Link to view all apps in a separate location.
Set this property if you want the "See all" links
to appear at the bottom of your apps list. (Optional)

properties.name: allAppsText
properties.description:
Text for the link to view all apps in a separate location.
Will not show up if `all-apps-url` is not set. (Optional)

properties.name: open
properties.description: Opens the dropdown menu when `open` is set to true.
